result.execSummary:
The defendant Bonnie C Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant to comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Defendant to undertake analysis of medication regimine and pain managment with agent and treating physician.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bonnie C Fischer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from the Court to Atty Kurzynski
from Atty Kurzynski regarding the DNA surcharge

Case called @ 2:40 p.m. Defendant Bonnie C Fischer in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Kurzynski. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 1 year probation - Conditions: Follow through will all counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, DE to undertake analysis of medication regimine and pain managment with agent and treating physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski in court.  Steven Anderson  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kurzynski states matter has been resolved.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Pre-trial conference at 04-15-2015 02:30 pm.
Status conference at 05-01-2015 03:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:20 PM: Defendant Bonnie C Fischer in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Atty Kurzynski acknowledges probable cause, NGP received and entered.  DA argues as to $1000 Signature Bond.  No objection by defense other than bond conditions - explains Def's chronic medical issues.  Requests Court not order any conditions - monetary bond only.  DA argues that bond conditions be ordered as requested.  The Court:  Orders $1000 Signature Bond as requested under the current terms of the law as required - conditions ordered.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State finding the existence of probable cause.  Court addresses the waiver of any conflict of interest of Atty Kurzynski due to  dual representation of counsel with her husband, James Fischer.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of any conflict.  Dual representation will be allowed.  Written waiver of any conflict filed by Atty Kurzynski.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
